description: NEW: Force Capture Button - Manual screenshot trigger from UI
steps: Step 1: Navigate to app at http://localhost:34115
Step 2: Look for a Force Capture or Camera button in the header/toolbar
Step 3: Click the Force Capture button
Step 4: Verify a new screenshot is captured and appears in the timeline

description: NEW: Capture Pause/Resume - Temporarily pause tracking without stopping daemon
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings or find pause control in toolbar
Step 2: Click Pause Capture button
Step 3: Verify capture is paused (status indicator changes)
Step 4: Click Resume button and verify capture resumes

description: NEW: Storage Statistics Display - Show database and screenshot storage usage
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Storage section
Step 3: Verify database size is displayed
Step 4: Verify screenshot storage size is displayed
Step 5: Verify total storage usage is shown

description: NEW: Open Data Directory - Quick access button to open data folder
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find data directory section
Step 3: Click 'Open Data Directory' button
Step 4: Verify file manager opens to correct location

description: NEW: Screenshot Quality Presets - Low/Medium/High quality selection
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find screenshot quality setting
Step 3: Verify preset options (Low, Medium, High) are available
Step 4: Select a preset and verify quality value changes accordingly

description: NEW: Date Range Selection in Timeline - Custom date range picker
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Timeline page
Step 2: Look for date range selector component
Step 3: Select a custom date range (e.g., last 7 days)
Step 4: Verify timeline displays sessions from selected range

description: NEW: Quick Date Jumps - Jump to specific dates quickly (This Week, Last Week, etc.)
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Timeline page
Step 2: Find quick date jump buttons/dropdown
Step 3: Click 'Last Week' or similar option
Step 4: Verify timeline navigates to that date range

description: NEW: Data Source Indicators on Session Cards - Show which sources have data
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Timeline page with sessions
Step 2: Look at session cards
Step 3: Verify icons indicating shell/git/files/browser data availability
Step 4: Verify indicator only appears when that data source has events for session

description: NEW: Git Repository Auto-Discovery - Find git repos in specified paths
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Git Tracking section
Step 3: Enter a directory path to scan for git repositories
Step 4: Click Scan/Discover button
Step 5: Verify discovered repositories are listed

description: NEW: Browser Selection UI - Choose which browsers to track
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Browser Tracking section
Step 3: See checkboxes for Chrome, Firefox, Safari, Edge, Brave
Step 4: Toggle browser selection and verify setting is saved

description: NEW: Domain Exclusion for Browser - Exclude specific domains from tracking
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Browser Tracking section
Step 3: Add a domain to exclusion list
Step 4: Verify domain is saved and displayed in exclusion list

description: NEW: Shell Exclude Patterns UI - Configure command patterns to exclude
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Shell Tracking section
Step 3: Add a regex pattern to exclude (e.g., 'ssh .*password')
Step 4: Verify pattern is saved to exclusion list

description: NEW: File Extension Filtering UI - Filter file events by extension
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find File Tracking section
Step 3: Add file extensions to exclude (e.g., .log, .tmp)
Step 4: Verify extensions are saved to filter list

description: NEW: Settings Page Organization - Collapsible sections for each feature area
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Verify sections are organized logically (Capture, Tracking, Data Sources, Storage)
Step 3: Verify sections are collapsible with clear headers
Step 4: Take screenshot to verify visual organization

description: NEW: Model Download Progress Indicator - Show progress when downloading AI models
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find AI/Inference section
Step 3: Initiate a model download
Step 4: Verify progress bar shows download percentage
Step 5: Verify completion status when done

description: NEW: Custom API Endpoints - Configure custom endpoints for cloud providers
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find AI/Inference section and select Cloud API
Step 3: Find option for custom endpoint URL
Step 4: Enter a custom endpoint and save
Step 5: Verify setting persists after page reload

description: NEW: API Key Management - Securely store and manage API keys
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find AI/Inference section
Step 3: Enter an API key (should be masked/hidden)
Step 4: Verify key is saved securely
Step 5: Verify key field shows masked value on reload

description: NEW: Hour Groups in Day View - Group screenshots by hour
steps: Step 1: Navigate to a Day page with activity (e.g., /day/2024-01-08)
Step 2: Verify screenshots are grouped by hour
Step 3: Verify hour headers show time range (e.g., '9:00 AM - 10:00 AM')
Step 4: Verify groups can be expanded/collapsed

description: NEW: Data Source Stats Visual Polish - Icons and visual hierarchy for data sources
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Analytics page
Step 2: Find Data Sources section
Step 3: Verify each source (Shell, Git, Files, Browser) has appropriate icon
Step 4: Verify stats are visually organized with clear typography

description: NEW: Database Optimization Button - Manual VACUUM/optimize option
steps: Step 1: Navigate to Settings page
Step 2: Find Storage section
Step 3: Click 'Optimize Database' button
Step 4: Verify optimization runs and shows completion message
